name: perspicuity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being clear and easy to understand: The decisions themselves are models of perspicuity and judicial soundness. Every word that contributes neither to perspicuity nor ornament, may be called vicious.
the ability to think, write, or speak clearly: Virginia, with her usual perspicuity, commented afterwards on her hostess's vitality. However, this golden opportunity is hardly the result of business perspicuity.
More examplesFewer examplesThe book gains not only perspicuity but also gripping momentum as the story moves chronologically.The proper placing of words depends upon perspicuity and precision.Joe recited this couplet with such manifest pride and careful perspicuity, that I asked him if he had written it himself.
